modName: Max Weapon Adjust - Dirty Clipping Workaround for Vanilla Replacers
summary: This mod increases the "Weapon Adjust" value on all Vanilla "ArmorAddon" files to the maximum of 4.0, pushing sheathed weapons on your back further away to reduce clipping.  It will also affect any custom armors that use the vanilla ArmorAddon files.  Read on for more details.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#00FF00][center][heading]Max Weapon Adjust - Dirty Clipping Workaround for Vanilla Replacers[/heading][/center][/color]

[color=#00FF00][b]Mods used in screenshots list at near the bottom of description since a few folks asked![/b][/color]

[color=#00FF00][b]Introduction and Important Points[/b][/color]

Hello, thank you for checking out my first mod ever, I hope it is useful.

[color=green][b]First off let me start by saying that this wasn't an original idea, while I don't know the original source of this information I first saw it from user "panzersnapdragon1" in this thread: [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/820929-if-it-doesnt-already-exist-weapon-clipping-issues/]http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/820929-if-it-doesnt-already-exist-weapon-clipping-issues/[/url] where he described how it could be done. All I've done is the busy work of making it happen and packaging it up, hopefully saving others time and effort. Thanks to panzersnapdragon1 for the idea, I've tried to put it into action.[/b][/color]

[color=red]
Known Issues/Disclosures (TLDR)
[list]
[*]This mod is intended for those bothered by greatswords and axes clipping through their back/backsides. Typically it's a problem for those with custom bodies and cbbe bodyslide settings.
[*]This mod seeks to alleviate the problem by increasing the "Weapon Adjust" value on ALL vanilla ArmorAddons for Skyrim, Dawnguard, and Dragonborn to the maximum possible of 4.0
[*]Because of the way Weapon Adjust works this will affect any items when sheathed, so one handed swords at your side will stick out more even though they may not need to. This might be distracting to some.
[*]This mod will work with vanilla armor and vanilla armor replacers that use the vanilla armoraddon files in Skyrim and the DLCs. It will not work on custom armor unless you make the change yourself or I make patches.
[*]This mod isn't perfect, if the body weight is too high, or the mesh too big you will still see clipping. However it was helpful for me so I'm hoping it helps others.
[*]I messed up the version number in the info.xml in the file so NMM always shows as out of date. Assuming this gets a future update I will fix it at that point but I don't want to make an update just to fix the version number.
[/list]
[/color]

Originally I made this for me and thought that it could be useful for others as well so I learned how to package it up and distribute on the nexus so that others may use it too.

A note about this being a "Dirty" mod. In my mind it is dirty because it is more about avoiding an issue than it is about actually fixing it. Fixing this problem is beyond my expertise, the best I can do is try to make it less noticeable.

I use this with the "Remodeled Armor for CBBE Bodyslide and BBP Armor 4.4.3 by ChronoTrigger77", but it should work with other sets that replace vanilla armors because they use same ArmorAddon files.

[color=#00FF00][b]Installation[/b][/color]

Nexus Mod Manager (Best Option): Using nexus mod manager follow the guided install wizard and check the boxes for Skyrim, Dawnguard (if you have it) and Dragonborn (if you have it).

Manual: Download the 7z and extract it. Inside you will see folders for the "000 - Skyrim - Main Files", "001 - Skyrim - Dawnguard Patch", and "002 - Skyrim - Dragonborn Patch". Inside each of these folders is an .esp, copy the desired ones for main files and expansion packs into your SkyrimData folder and make sure they are marked for loading.

[color=#00FF00][b]Changelog[/b][/color]

[list]
[*]4/6/2014 - Version 0.1b - Beta Release
[/list]

[color=#00FF00][b]What This Mod Changes[/b][/color]

I want to share this in case others find it useful.

I followed a short post from user "panzersnapdragon1" in this thread: [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/820929-if-it-doesnt-already-exist-weapon-clipping-issues/]http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/820929-if-it-doesnt-already-exist-weapon-clipping-issues/[/url] he outlined that by changing the "Weapon Adjust" value for Armor Addons you can fix some of the issues. I then set out to max this value out for all vanilla armors and torso objects so that when wearing armor or not wearing armor the greatsword is further back to avoid clipping. The weapon does hang more in "mid air" but I find that less disturbing than getting a butt shave with every step.

What I changed:

[color=#00FF00][b]Mods Used In Screenshots[/b][/color]

Body/Armor Mods Used in the Screenshots

These are all the mods I use to set character appearance/aspects. I've pasted the name/version/creator direct from Nexus Mod Manager and then added the link to the mod in question after the dash. The formatting is "Mod Name" "Version" "Author" "Link"

Body/Skeleton Specific (Meshes/Models):

Calientes Female Body Mod Big Bottom Edition -CBBE- 3.2.3 Caliente - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/?[/url]
XP32 Maximum Skeleton -XPMS 1.93a xp32 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26800/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26800/?[/url]
BodySlide 2 and Outfit Studio 2.0.0.10 Caliente - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/?[/url]

Oblivion Hair Pack Fixed now with NPCEditor Support 2.3.1 DragonAge7 - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/22598/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/22598/?[/url]

The Body is a custom body slide, I think in this image weight was set around 80%. Here is the XML data from the preset, once you have all mod installed save this as an xml file in SkyrimDataCalienteToolsBodySlideSliderPresets, select CalienteAdvanced in bodyslide 2 and then use this preset and batch build the armor.

[quote]
